title: Diabetes Risk — diabetes
text: Subset survey data collected US National Center Health Statistics (NCHS). original data based home interviews 5,000 people per years, 1999-2004.

title: Diabetes Risk — diabetes
text: data frame 9096 observations following 23 variables. sex "male" "female" age age subject years pregnant "yes" "" ethnicity Mexican American, Hispanic, Non-Hispanic White, Non-Hispanic Black, /Multi smoker "yes" "" diabetic "yes" "" height height (meters) weight weight (kilograms) waist waist circumference (meters) wci proposed body shape index bmi body mass index ptfat percent trunk fat tfat mass trunk fat lfat limb fat llean limb lean tissue lbmi lean-tissue BMI fbmi fat-BMI bbmi bone BMI pfat percent fat bmd bone mineral density fmhm_other Framingham risk score hdl HDL cholesterol chol cholesterol (LDL?) bps systolic blood pressure, mmHg bpd diastolic blood pressure, mmHg income ratio family income poverty threshold. (5 stands ratio greater equal 5)

title: Diabetes Risk — diabetes

title: Fire-setting Among Teenagers — firesetting
text: Modifed dataset obtained course study factors associated fire-setting among -risk youth.  data comes national surveys -risk teenagers.

title: Fire-setting Among Teenagers — firesetting
text: data frame 975 observations following 6 variables. age Child's age years. sex Sex child. race Child's race. school.attitude measure child's perceptions school, combined surveys given child /parents.  Higher scores indicate poorer attitudes. academic measure child's academic performance.  Higher scores indicate academic problems. adhd Scaled scores test AHDH.  Higher scores indicates problems ADHD. fires Whether child sets fires (0 = , 1 = ).

title: Fire-setting Among Teenagers — firesetting
text: Doctroal dissertation Carrie H. Bowling, University Kentucky, 2013.. details ../doc/firesetting_phd_proposal.pdf.

title: Territoriality: The Experiment — parkExp
text: data frame 237 observations following 12 variables. confcar type car waiting parking spot (just drove ).  Either Nissan Maxima Infinity Q45. car "confronting" parked car, hence name variable. sex Sex driver parked car. race Race driver parked car. num Number people parked car (including driver). horn Thhe waiting car either honked horn , honk . carval Book value parked car, dollars. month Month incident occurred. day Day week incident occurred. miltime Time incident occurred, military units. example, 1130 denotes 11:30AM, 1350 denotes 1:50PM. time Time seconds parked car depart parking spot. ccstatus Status waiting "confronting" car.  Maxima considered low-status car, whereas Infinity Q45 expensive, "high-status" car. valuediff Difference value confronting car parked car, dollars.  values confronting cars follows: Maxima:  5200, Infinity Q45:  57000.

title: Territoriality: The Experiment — parkExp
text: "Territorial Defense Parking Lots: Retaliation Waiting Drivers", B. Ruback D. Juieng, Journal Applied Social Psychology, Volume 27, Issue 9, May 1997, pp. 821-834. Provided B. Ruback.

title: Territoriality in Pay-Phones — payphones
text: people using public pay-phone talk longer someone waiting use phone? experiment, conducted 1989, "investigators measured length time (seconds) subjects spent telephone one three conditions: alone (), one person using adjacent telphone (B), one person using adjacent telephone another person waiting use one two telephones. study conducted alcove shopping mall, area contained two adjacent telphones." (Quotation Business Statistics, 6th. ed. 1992, W. Daniel J. Terrell.)

text: data frame 56 observations following 3 variables. sex Sex subject. treatment condition subject put (, B C described ) researchers. time Time seconds subject spent phone.

title: Territoriality in Pay-Phones — payphones
text: See Study 5 R.B. Ruback, K.D. Poe, P.Doriat, "Waiting Phone: Intrusion Callers Leads Territorial Defense" Social Psychology Quarterly, 52:232-241. Gender data provided R.B. Ruback (personal communication).

Values along book-titles follows:  hunger = Hunger Games, shades Fifty Shades Gray, fault = Fault Stars, martian = Martian, unbroken =  Unbroken, gonegirl =  Gone Girl, goldfinch =  Goldfinch rating rating assigned (1-5) URL_fragment Prepend "https://www.amazon.com/" get full URL review. review_title Title review; usually concise judgment book. content HTML review text.

title: Amazon.com Book Reviews — reviews

what: Weather data from Macleish Field Stations — whately_2015
title: Weather data from Macleish Field Stations — whately_2015
text: Weather data collected Macleish Field Station Whately, MA 2015.  copy whately_2015 data package `macleish`: <https://github.com/beanumber/macleish>.

title: Weather data from Macleish Field Stations — whately_2015
text: , data frame ([dplyr::tbl_df()]) roughly 52,560 rows 8 9 variables. following variables values found either `whately_2015` `orchard_2015` data tables. variables averaged 10 minute interval unless otherwise noted. Timestamp measurement set Eastern Standard Time. temperature average temperature, Celsius wind_speed Wind speed, meters per second wind_dir Wind direction, degrees rel_humidity much water air, millimeters pressure Atmospheric pressure, millibars rainfall Total rainfall, millimeters solar_radiation Amount radiation coming sun, Watts/meters^2. Solar measurement Whately par_density Photosynthetically Active Radiation (sunlight 400 700 nm), average density Watts/meters^2. One two solar measurements Orchard par_total Photosynthetically Active Radiation (sunlight 400 700 nm), average total measurement period Watts/meters^2. One two solar measurements Orchard

title: Weather data from Macleish Field Stations — whately_2015
text: data recorded <https://www.smith.edu/-smith/sustainable-smith/ceeds>

title: Weather data from Macleish Field Stations — whately_2015
text: Macleish Field Station remote outpost owned Smith College used field research. two weather stations premises. One called `WhatelyMet` `OrchardMet`. `WhatelyMet` station located (42.448470, -72.680553) `OrchardMet` station (42.449653, -72.680315). `WhatelyMet` located end Poplar Hill Road Whately, Massachusetts, USA. meteorological instruments `WhatelyMet` (except rain gauge) mounted top tower 25.3 m tall, well surrounding forest canopy. tower located local ridge elevation 250.75m sea level. `OrchardMet` located 250 m north first tower open field next apple orchard. Full canopy trees (~20 m tall) within 30 m station. station standard instrument configuration temperature, relative humidity, solar radiation, barometric pressure measured 1.5 2.0 m ground. Wind speed direction measured 10 m tall tower precipitation measured ground. Ground temperature measured 15 30 cm ground surface 2 m south tower. tower located 258.1 m sea level. Data collection OrchardMet began June 27th, 2014. variables shown weather data collected `WhatelyMet` `OrchardMet` 2015. Solar radiation measured two different ways: see `SlrW_Avg``PAR` variables Photosynthetic Active Radiation. Note loose wire resulted erroneous temperature reading OrchardMet late November, 2015.
